description: A suit of thick leather body armor that has been hardened via chemical treatment.  Light and strong.
Leg and body armor made from the exoskeletons of insects.
Leg and body armor crafted from the carefully cleaned and pruned biosilicified exoskeletons of acidic ants.  Acid-resistant but brittle.
Thick body armor made from furs.
Thick body armor made from faux furs.
A full suit of thick leather armor.  Relatively light and comfortable.
A suit of medieval plate armor.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion, and the leather straps are tattered.
A suit of medieval full plate armor, covering everything but the head and neck.  This would likely be uncomfortable without something soft underneath.
This full suit of medieval platemail, complete with a chain hood and plastic face shield, has been strapped over some kind of cleansuit and strung with copper wiring.
Thick leather body armor reinforced by the addition of sheet metal plates.

A full suit of black plastic body armor plates used by riot police.  Cleverly placed velcro straps secure each piece, resulting in slightly less encumbrance then its constituent parts.  MOLLE webbing is attached to the torso and the word POLICE is emblazoned across the front.
An ornamental suit of Japanese samurai armor.
A suit of armor made from thick chunks of rubber tire secured by simple strings; the loose collection of rubber plates provides decent but not the most convenient protection.

A white suit commonly worn by professional beekeepers with straps on your ankles and wrists to prevent bees from flying in.  It's not a very tough fabric, but it's lightweight and has plenty of storage thanks to a chest pocket.
A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking steel rings.  It can be adjusted to be worn as outerwear.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a looser fit.

//: Suits have better coverage than separates because the parts are all attached to each other, leaving fewer gaps.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a looser fit.
You adjust your mail for a looser fit.

description: A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking steel rings.  It can be adjusted to fit closer to the body.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a closer fit.
You adjust your mail for a closer fit.
You adjust your mail for a closer fit.

description: A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking low-quality steel rings.  It can be adjusted to be worn as outerwear.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a looser fit.

description: A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking low-quality steel rings.  It can be adjusted to fit closer to the body.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a closer fit.

description: A full-body suit of medieval chain armor, complete with a hood, gloves, and chausses.

armor.//: Combining the skirt and chausses here still leaves us with a few small gaps.

description: Jury-rigged armor made by affixing a full-body suit of chainmail over a rubber cleansuit, with copper wire threaded through to create a low impedence route to the ground that doesn't travel through the wearer.  It is hot, heavy, and uncomfortable, and the plastic face shield doesn't help.

A hooded boiler suit, complete with bulky gloves and boots, that covers everything but the face in impermeable rubber fabric.  Though not designed to stand up to combat, it should protect from chemicals, radiation, and other environmental hazards.  A tag advises the user to wear an activated gas mask while working in these conditions.
An aluminized whole-body garment worn by firefighters and foundry workers as protection against flames.
//: This should require a separate SCBA system for breathing smoke/900 degree air, but currently doesn't because of how enviro is coded.
//1: todo: Duplicate how gasmasks work but make them run on air tanks. Make that a requirement for breathing in hot air.

description: Designed to stop the injuries of dog bites, this thick, one piece suit is often used in the rehabilitation of abused animals and in training dogs by the police and military.  A base layer of aramid fabric has had strips of soft body armor sewn into it to mimic quilting, and to soften the blunt of animals jumping, slashing, or pouncing on the wearer.
//: real bite suits are made with linen, but we don't have linen, so denim is the closest approx. (canvas is always waterproofed and these suits are not)

armor.//: skip second entry for arm encumbrance

//: Should be substantially more difficult to repair than ordinary rubber - glass is difficulty 7
description: An impermeable full-body garment with a clear plastic face shield, rubber gloves, and boots, looking like a soft, puffy space suit.  It looks fragile, but a tag on the interior explains that it will provide excellent protection from radiation, pathogens, chemicals, toxins, and even electrical discharge, so long as it's in good condition.
//1: TODO: Suits like this require negative pressure and air tanks to work. See also the entry suit.
//2: Mask includes vinyl to keep it from being uncomfortable. Todo: make PADDED work per BP.

description: A snug body suit made from thin and lightweight Nomex fire-resistant fabric.  Tough yet breathable, it is light and comfortable to wear under clothing.

A glossy boiler suit complete with rubber gloves and steel-toed boots, this getup is the sort of thing you might see in a documentary about Chernobyl.  It lacks any branding, but a label on the inside explains that the suit is flame-resistant, chemical resistant, and when paired with a gas mask, could provide protection from biological agents and radioactive particles.  A bold warning mentions that suit only protects from electric shock while the wearer is grounded and the suit is worn properly.

use_action.msg: You slip out of the top of the suit and tie the sleeves around your waist.

description: A glossy boiler suit complete with rubber gloves and steel-toed boots, this getup is the sort of thing you might see in a documentary about Chernobyl.  It lacks any branding, but a label on the inside explains that the suit is flame-resistant, chemical resistant, and when paired with a gas mask, could provide protection from biological agents and radioactive particles.  A bold warning mentions that suit only protects from electric shock while the wearer is grounded and the suit is worn properly.

use_action.msg: You pull the upper part of the suit along with its gloves hood on and zip it up securely.

description: A single-piece brown and orange environmental suit, tailored in a way that slightly recalls a military flight suit.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.

use_action.msg: You slip out of the top of the suit and tie the sleeves around your waist.

description: A single-piece brown and orange environmental suit, tailored in a way that slightly recalls a military flight suit.  The upper portion has been tied around the waist casually.

use_action.msg: You untie the sleeves and put back on the top of the suit.

description: The WebbStar moisture retention suit utilizes advanced technology to prevent up to 30% of moisture loss through perspiration.  The suit is powered by the micro-motions of the body, especially breathing and walking motions.  Because of this, your walking speed is impaired while wearing it.
A suit of formal attire.  Makes the apocalypse a truly gentlemanly experience.
A leather bodysuit with padding in high-impact areas, meant for motorcyclists out on the track.  The leather is stiff but makes the armor much sturdier and more protective than lighter counterparts.

A military officer's dress uniform from before the Cataclysm, complete with rank and ribbons.  Just looking at it gives you an air of authority.  Perhaps not the most practical military wear, but a very stylish option.
A sage-green US military flight suit.  It has various insignia embroidered onto it.
